On 7/26/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
> What do people on the list prefer? Working with Files or
> Streams/Readers/Writers? For what reasons?
> Please share your thoughts.
>

I always TDD using Streams or Readers/Writers for several reasons :

1. It's easier to TDD if you don't interact with the filesystem
2. It's more expressive. Stream implies binary and Reader/Writer implies char.
3. It's more flexible for my callers - they have control over
encoding/buffering etc and can hook me up with a socket or a pipe or
whatever.

If the primary caller is going to be working with Files, I'll usually
overload the method to take a File too.

Kevin
